intro: Drimia alta, commonly known as the high drimia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its tall, grass-like leaves and striking yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny areas and is adapted to well-drained soils. Drimia alta is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its elegant appearance. It is also used in traditional medicine in some regions for its purported health benefits.
